item.title: Error
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

[quote=“Westbay, post:16, topic:306402”]i know this might sound stupid

x = x - 1;

but that makes no sense to me[/quote]

how does that not make sense? are you in like 3rd grade? have you not taken basic algebra yet??

Read full topic

item.title: Error
item.dc:creator: @Westbay Westbay
item.description:
@Westbay wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:17, topic:306402”][quote author=Westbay link=topic=402556.msg2986697#msg2986697 date=1255033001]
i know this might sound stupid

x = x - 1;

but that makes no sense to me
[/quote]if x = 2 then
(x = x - 1) = (2 = 2 - 1) = 1

the short hand for that is ‘x -= 1’[/quote]

ok thank you

Read full topic

item.title: Error
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

So I decided to drop C# for Java. This is my second day and my book (Head First Java) gave me a code to put together.
So I did and this is what I came up with

[code]public class Shuffle {
public static void main(String[] args) {

int x = 3;

while (x > 0) {

if (x == 1) {
	System.out.print("d");
	x = x - 1;
}

if (x == 2) {
	System.out.print("b c");
 }
 
 if (x > 2) {
	System.out.print("a");
}

x = x - 1;
System.out.print("-");

}
}
}
[/code]

Now I’m pretty sure the code is right [if not please point out the error] and I keep getting this error

C:\Users\owner\Desktop\Java>javac Shuffle error: Class names, 'Shuffle', are only accepted if annotation processing is explicitly requested 1 error
Now the stupid error wont let me compile it..

Can anyone help me with the error? Thanks.

[Please keep in mind, this is only my second day.]

Read full topic
